timeline.message: make room for new new api
use first part of email address only
fix capitalization and rename. don't create empty property change objects

timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: there's a lot of duplication between the two queryStrings.  What can we reuse?
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Yeah...I'm trying not to get too fancy here without using a real DSL for query building. However, it's easy enough to split out the select statement, timestamp checks, and limit.
replies.author: jaycarlton

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/api/src/main/java/org/pmiops/workbench/actionaudit/ActionAuditQueryServiceImpl.java b/api/src/main/java/org/pmiops/workbench/actionaudit/ActionAuditQueryServiceImpl.java
index 825e825dc..00aad5498 100644
--- a/api/src/main/java/org/pmiops/workbench/actionaudit/ActionAuditQueryServiceImpl.java
+++ b/api/src/main/java/org/pmiops/workbench/actionaudit/ActionAuditQueryServiceImpl.java

@@ -24,6 +24,25 @@ public class ActionAuditQueryServiceImpl implements ActionAuditQueryService {
 
   private static final int MICROSECONDS_IN_MILLISECOND = 1000;
   private static final long MAX_QUERY_LIMIT = 1000L;
+  private static final String QUERY_FORMAT =
+      "SELECT\n"
+          + "  TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(CAST(jsonPayload.timestamp AS INT64)) as event_time,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.agent_type AS agent_type,\n"
+          + "  CAST(jsonPayload.agent_id AS INT64) AS agent_id,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.agent_email AS agent_username,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.action_id AS action_id,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.action_type AS action_type,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.target_type AS target_type,\n"
+          + "  CAST(jsonPayload.target_id AS INT64) AS target_id,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.target_property AS target_property,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.prev_value AS prev_value,\n"
+          + "  jsonPayload.new_value AS new_value\n"
+          + "FROM %s\n"
+          + "WHERE %s AND\n"
+          + "  @after <= TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(CAST(jsonPayload.timestamp AS INT64)) AND\n"
+          + "  TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(CAST(jsonPayload.timestamp AS INT64)) < @before\n"
+          + "ORDER BY event_time, agent_id, action_id\n"
+          + "LIMIT @limit";
 
   private final AuditLogEntryMapper auditLogEntryMapper;
   private final BigQueryService bigQueryService;

timeline.bodyText: is this the only one that was added?  looks like it
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: yes I believe so. When alphabetizing, you exchange a one-time ugly diff for better merge management in the future and easier-to-find items.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: any idea what this comment meant?
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText:
I originally wrote it, and at the time I was fighting with the user provider and understanding how the scopes work. In particular, you can shoot yourself in the foot if you manage to use a provider outside of its intended scope, and it's also possible to confuse the administrator deleting the user with the user being deleted if you're not careful.
It doesn't add any clarity anymore though so I nixed it.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: The fully constructed username would be better here
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: update the comments in workbench-api.yaml to match the new name
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Please check our constellation of googledocs for references to this value.
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: yes, that's an immediate post-merge activity.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText:
what if these objects don't have a common ID or don't have a common event time?
It seems that this is an important assumption/requirement for your use case, so maybe it should be enforced along with the non-empty condition.
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: oh it's cause you're grouping by action ID.  ok then.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText:
I thought about doing that. Initially these were private methods, but then everything seemed to fit better on the mapper, but I don't believe it's possible to create a private helper method on a mapper.
Technically, they could have different event times due to an upstream bug, but I don't feel like it's appropriate to enforce that here. Maybe a cron to scan the BQ dataset now and then for sanity would suffice there.
replies.author: jaycarlton
